questions.question: Which AWS offering enables customers to find, buy, and immediately start using software solutions in their AWS environment?
questions.explanation: AWS Marketplace is a digital catalog that lets customers find, purchase, and deploy third-party software that runs on AWS. Solutions can be launched directly into an AWS account without manual installation.

questions.question: Which AWS networking service enables a company to create a virtual network within AWS?
questions.explanation: Amazon VPC lets you create an isolated virtual network inside AWS where you can define IP ranges, subnets, route tables, and gateways.

questions.question: Which of the following is AWS's responsibility under the AWS shared responsibility model?
questions.explanation: Under the shared responsibility model, AWS is responsible for the security of the cloud, including physical data centers, hardware, and networking equipment.

questions.question: Which component of AWS global infrastructure does Amazon CloudFront use to ensure low-latency delivery?
questions.explanation: CloudFront uses edge locations, which are geographically distributed endpoints that cache and deliver content closer to users for lower latency.

questions.question: How would a system administrator add an additional layer of login security to a user's AWS Management Console?

options.text: Audit AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) roles

questions.explanation: Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) adds an extra security layer by requiring users to provide a second form of authentication in addition to their password.

questions.question: Which service can identify the user that made the API call when an Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance is terminated?

options.text: AWS Identity and Access Management (AWS IAM)

questions.explanation: AWS CloudTrail records all API calls and identifies which user or role performed an action, such as terminating an EC2 instance.

questions.question: Which service would you use to send alerts based on Amazon CloudWatch alarms?
questions.explanation: Amazon SNS is used to send notifications and alerts triggered by CloudWatch alarms via email, SMS, or other endpoints.

questions.question: Where can a customer find information about prohibited actions on AWS infrastructure?
questions.explanation: The AWS Acceptable Use Policy defines prohibited activities such as abuse, illegal usage, and security violations.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of how moving to the AWS Cloud reduces upfront cost?

options.text: By replacing large variable costs with lower capital investments
By replacing large capital investments with lower variable costs
By allowing the provisioning of compute and storage at a fixed level to meet peak demand
By replacing the repeated scaling of virtual servers with a simpler fixed-scale model

questions.explanation: AWS replaces large upfront capital expenses with pay-as-you-go pricing, allowing customers to pay only for what they use.

questions.question: When designing a typical three-tier web application, which AWS services and/or features improve availability and reduce the impact failures? (Choose two.)

options.text: AWS Auto Scaling for Amazon EC2 instances
Amazon VPC subnet ACLs to check the health of a service
Distributed resources across multiple Availability Zones
AWS Server Migration Service (AWS SMS) to move Amazon EC2 instances into a different Region
Distributed resources across multiple AWS points of presence

questions.explanation: Auto Scaling and multiple Availability Zones improve fault tolerance by automatically replacing failed instances and distributing workloads across isolated data centers.

questions.question: Which cloud design principle aligns with AWS Cloud best practices?

options.text: Create fixed dependencies among application components
Aggregate services on a single instance
Deploy applications in a single Availability Zone
Distribute the compute load across multiple resources

questions.explanation: Distributing compute load across multiple resources improves resilience, scalability, and performance, which aligns with AWS best practices.

questions.question: Which of the following are recommended practices for managing IAM users? (Choose two.)

options.text: Require IAM users to change their passwords after a specified period of time
Prevent IAM users from reusing previous passwords
Recommend that the same password be used on AWS and other sites
Require IAM users to store their passwords in raw text
Disable multi-factor authentication (MFA) for IAM users

questions.explanation: IAM best practices include enforcing password rotation and preventing password reuse to reduce the risk of compromised credentials.

questions.question:
A company is migrating from on-premises data centers to the AWS Cloud and is looking for hands-on help with the project.
How can the company get this support? (Choose two.)

options.text: Ask for a quote from the AWS Marketplace team to perform a migration into the company's AWS account.
Contact AWS Support and open a case for assistance
Use AWS Professional Services to provide guidance and to set up an AWS Landing Zone in the company's AWS account
Select a partner from the AWS Partner Network (APN) to assist with the migration
Use Amazon Connect to create a new request for proposal (RFP) for expert assistance in migrating to the AWS Cloud.

questions.explanation: AWS Professional Services and AWS Partner Network (APN) partners provide expert, hands-on help for planning and executing cloud migrations.

questions.question: How does the AWS Enterprise Support Concierge team help users?

options.text: Answering questions regarding technical support cases

questions.explanation: The Concierge team assists AWS Enterprise Support customers with billing, account, and invoicing issues.

questions.question: An application designed to span multiple Availability Zones is described as:
questions.explanation: An application running across multiple Availability Zones is considered highly available because it can survive failures in a single data center.

questions.question:
A new service using AWS must be highly available. Yet, due to regulatory requirements, all of its Amazon EC2 instances must be located in a single geographic area.
According to best practices, to meet these requirements, the EC2 instances must be placed in at least two:
questions.explanation: Availability Zones are separate data centers within the same Region, allowing high availability while meeting geographic or regulatory constraints.

questions.question: Which AWS tool is used to compare the cost of running an application on-premises to running the application in the AWS Cloud?
questions.explanation: The AWS Pricing Calculator estimates the cost of running workloads on AWS and allows comparisons with on-premises environments.

questions.question:
A company has multiple AWS accounts within AWS Organizations and wants to apply the Amazon EC2 Reserved Instances benefit to a single account only.
Which action should be taken?

options.text: Purchase the Reserved Instances from master payer account and turn off Reserved Instance sharing.
Enable billing alerts in the AWS Billing and Cost Management console.
Purchase the Reserved Instances in individual linked accounts and turn off Reserved Instance sharing from the payer level.
Enable Reserved Instance sharing in the AWS Billing and Cost Management console.

questions.explanation: Disabling Reserved Instance sharing ensures that the Reserved Instance discount applies only to the account that purchased it.

questions.question: Which situation should be reported to the AWS Abuse team?

options.text: In Availability Zone has a service disruption
An intrusion attempt is made from an AWS IP address
A user has trouble accessing an Amazon S3 bucket from an AWS IP address
A user needs to change payment methods due to a compromise

questions.explanation: The AWS Abuse team handles reports of malicious or illegal activity, such as intrusion attempts originating from AWS resources.

questions.question:
A company is planning to launch an ecommerce site in a single AWS Region to a worldwide user base.
Which AWS services will allow the company to reach users and provide low latency and high transfer speeds? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: AWS Global Accelerator and Amazon CloudFront route users to the closest AWS edge locations, providing low latency and fast content delivery worldwide.

questions.question: Which AWS service or resource is serverless?
questions.explanation: AWS Lambda is serverless because AWS manages all servers and infrastructure while users only upload and run code.

questions.question: Which of the following are components of Amazon VPC? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Subnets and Internet Gateways are core VPC components that define network segmentation and internet connectivity.

questions.question: AWS Budgets can be used to:

options.text: prevent a given user from creating a resource
send an alert when the utilization of Reserved Instances drops below a certain percentage
set resource limits in AWS accounts to prevent overspending
split an AWS bill across multiple forms of payment

questions.explanation: AWS Budgets allow customers to define spending limits and receive alerts to prevent overspending.

questions.question: Which of the following will enhance the security of access to the AWS Management Console? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: MFA and password policies strengthen login security by requiring additional authentication factors and strong passwords.

questions.question: The AWS Trusted Advisor checks include recommendations regarding which of the following? (Choose two.)

options.text: Information on Amazon S3 bucket permissions
Multi-factor authentication enabled on the AWS account root user
Number of users in the account

questions.explanation: Trusted Advisor provides security checks such as public S3 bucket permissions and whether the root user has MFA enabled.

questions.question: Which functions can users perform using AWS KMS?

options.text: Create and manage AWS access keys for the AWS account root user
Create and manage AWS access keys for an AWS account IAM user
Create and manage keys for encryption and decryption of data
Create and manage keys for multi-factor authentication

questions.explanation: AWS KMS is used to create, manage, and control cryptographic keys for encrypting and decrypting data.

questions.question: How does AWS Trusted Advisor provide guidance to users of the AWS Cloud? (Choose two.)

options.text: It identifies software vulnerabilities in applications running on AWS
It provides a list of cost optimization recommendations based on current AWS usage
It detects potential security vulnerabilities caused by permissions settings on account resources
It automatically corrects potential security issues caused by permissions settings on account resources
It provides proactive alerting whenever an Amazon EC2 instance has been compromised

questions.explanation: Trusted Advisor identifies cost-saving opportunities and security risks based on how AWS resources are configured.

questions.question: Which of the following are advantages of the AWS Cloud? (Choose two.)

options.text: AWS manages the maintenance of the cloud infrastructure
AWS manages the security of applications built on AWS
AWS manages capacity planning for physical servers
AWS manages the development of applications on AWS
AWS manages cost planning for virtual servers

questions.explanation: AWS manages the physical infrastructure and server capacity planning, removing these responsibilities from customers.

questions.question:
A user deploys an Amazon RDS DB instance in multiple Availability Zones.
This strategy involves which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework?
questions.explanation: Using Multi-AZ deployments increases fault tolerance, which is part of the Reliability pillar of the Well-Architected Framework.

questions.question: Which AWS services provide a user with connectivity between the AWS Cloud and on-premises resources? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: AWS VPN and Direct Connect provide secure network connections between on-premises environments and AWS.

questions.question: Which AWS service is used to pay AWS bills, and monitor usage and budget costs?
questions.explanation: AWS Billing and Cost Management lets users view invoices, track usage, and manage budgets.

questions.question: Which element of the AWS global infrastructure consists of one or more discrete data centers, each with redundant power, networking, and connectivity, which are housed in separate facilities?
questions.explanation: Availability Zones are independent data centers with redundant power, networking, and connectivity within a Region.

questions.question: Which Amazon VPC feature enables users to capture information about the IP traffic that reaches Amazon EC2 instances?
questions.explanation: VPC Flow Logs capture network traffic information for troubleshooting, security analysis, and auditing.

questions.question: Which AWS service can be used to automatically scale an application up and down without making capacity planning decisions?
questions.explanation: Auto Scaling automatically adjusts capacity based on demand, removing the need for manual capacity planning.

questions.question: AWS Enterprise Support users have access to which service or feature that is not available to users with other AWS Support plans?
questions.explanation: The Concierge team is only available to Enterprise Support customers and provides billing and account assistance.

questions.question:
A company wants to migrate a MySQL database to AWS but does not have the budget for Database Administrators to handle routine tasks including provisioning, patching, and performing backups.
Which AWS service will support this use case?
questions.explanation: Amazon RDS is a managed database service that automates patching, backups, and maintenance.

questions.question:
A company wants to expand from one AWS Region into a second AWS Region.
What does the company need to do to start supporting the new Region?

options.text: Contact an AWS Account Manager to sign a new contract
Move an Availability Zone to the new Region
Begin deploying resources in the second Region
Download the AWS Management Console for the new Region

questions.explanation: To use a new AWS Region, customers simply deploy resources there; no contract or setup is required.

questions.question:
A user must meet compliance and software licensing requirements that state a workload must be hosted on a physical server.
Which Amazon EC2 instance pricing option will meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: Dedicated Hosts provide physical servers allocated to a single customer, meeting compliance and licensing requirements.

questions.question: Which AWS service will provide a way to generate encryption keys that can be used to encrypt data? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: AWS KMS and AWS CloudHSM both generate and manage encryption keys used to protect sensitive data.

questions.question:
A company is planning to migrate from on-premises to the AWS Cloud.
Which AWS tool or service provides detailed reports on estimated cost savings after migration?

options.text: AWS Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) Calculator

questions.explanation: The AWS TCO Calculator estimates the cost difference between on-premises infrastructure and AWS after migration.

questions.question: What can assist in evaluating an application for migration to the cloud? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: AWS Professional Services and APN partners help assess, plan, and execute cloud migrations.

questions.question: Which AWS service helps users meet contractual and regulatory compliance requirements for data security by using dedicated hardware appliances within the AWS Cloud?
questions.explanation: AWS CloudHSM provides dedicated hardware security modules for customers with strict compliance requirements.

questions.question: Under the AWS shared responsibility model, the customer manages which of the following? (Choose two.)

options.text: Patch management of an Amazon RDS instance operating system
Controlling physical access to data centers
Patch management of an Amazon EC2 instance operating system

questions.explanation: Customers are responsible for securing EC2 operating systems and configuring network security controls such as security groups and ACLs.

questions.question: Which AWS service is suitable for an event-driven workload?
questions.explanation: AWS Lambda runs code in response to events, making it ideal for event-driven architectures.

questions.question: What is a value proposition of the AWS Cloud?

options.text: AWS is responsible for security in the AWS Cloud
AWS manages user applications in the AWS Cloud

questions.explanation: AWS allows customers to use services without long-term contracts, enabling flexible, pay-as-you-go pricing.

questions.question: What is a characteristic of Amazon S3 cross-region replication?

options.text: Both source and destination S3 buckets must have versioning disabled
The source and destination S3 buckets cannot be in different AWS Regions
S3 buckets configured for cross-region replication can be owned by a single AWS account or by different accounts
The source S3 bucket owner must have the source and destination AWS Regions disabled for their account

questions.explanation: S3 cross-region replication supports buckets owned by the same or different AWS accounts.

questions.question: What is a user responsible for when running an application in the AWS Cloud?   - A. Managing physical hardware

options.text: Providing a list of users approved for data center access

questions.explanation: Under the shared responsibility model, customers are responsible for managing their application software.

questions.question:
A company that does business online needs to quickly deliver new functionality in an iterative manner, minimizing the time to market.
Which AWS Cloud feature can provide this?
questions.explanation: Agility allows companies to quickly experiment, deploy, and iterate new features without long provisioning cycles.

questions.question: Which features or services can be used to monitor costs and expenses for an AWS account? (Choose two.)

options.text: Billing alerts and Amazon CloudWatch alarms

questions.explanation: Cost and Usage Reports and billing alerts help customers monitor spending and detect unexpected charges.

questions.question: Amazon Route 53 enables users to:

options.text: establish a dedicated network connection to AWS

questions.explanation: Amazon Route 53 allows customers to register and manage DNS domain names and route internet traffic.
